title: 'Disenchantment Bay Tagging: Data Review'
author: "Stacie Hardy"

output: pdf_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE)

library(tidyverse)
library(stringr)
library(lubridate)
library(RPostgreSQL)
library(ggplot2)
library(reshape2)

# Connect to DB and get starting data
con <- RPostgreSQL::dbConnect(PostgreSQL(), 
                              dbname = Sys.getenv("pep_db"), 
                              host = Sys.getenv("pep_ip"), 
                              port = Sys.getenv("pep_port"),
                              user = Sys.getenv("pep_user"), 
                              password = "$e@l")

haulout <- RPostgreSQL::dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM telem.tbl_wc_haulout WHERE deployid LIKE \'PV2016%\'")


ggplot(haulout_2016_m, aes(value, deployid)) +
  geom_line(size=4) +
  xlab(NULL) +
  ylab(NULL) +
  ggtitle("Haulout by Seal") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(aspect.ratio = 0.4, axis.text = element_text(size = 7))
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
